entry.title: Combined summary - LN summit organisation (nully0x)
entry.summary: Antoine Riard, a member of the lightning dev community, has proposed organizing the LN Summit in Africa in June 2024. He believes Africa is an ideal location due to its rich cultural and historical past, fragmented financial systems that could benefit from a compatible payment protocol, a growing number of Lightning developers on the continent, and the potential for local Lightning economies to thrive. Antoine suggests starting small by surveying countries with operational stability like Algeria, Ghana, Senegal, and Nigeria. He plans to gather feedback privately from Lightning attendees using neutral and technical proof of work heuristics. Antoine emphasizes transparency and accountability, welcoming objections or suggestions from the lightning dev community. To address challenges such as visa travels and tropical weather, he believes it is essential to announce the summit far in advance. Antoine encourages a multi-stakeholder approach to ensure fairness and transparency. He has set up a dedicated communication endpoint, lnsummit2024 at ariard.me, for anyone interested in being part of the organization or transferring knowledge between generations of contributors. Antoine commits to strong transparency and accountability standards and encourages actions over mere talk in open-source matters.The Lightning-dev Digest, Vol 94, Issue 17, is a mailing list hosted by the Linux Foundation for developers and enthusiasts interested in the Lightning Network technology. The Lightning Network is a layer-two protocol that aims to enhance the scalability and speed of Bitcoin transactions. By utilizing payment channels, it enables faster and cheaper transactions by reducing the load on the blockchain. The Lightning-dev mailing list provides a space for technical discussions related to the Lightning Network. Members can share insights, ask questions, and collaborate on various aspects of the technology. It serves as a valuable resource for developers working on implementing Lightning Network solutions or exploring its potential use cases. The mailing list fosters an inclusive community where individuals can contribute their expertise and learn from others. Interested individuals can join the Lightning-dev mailing list by visiting the provided link and following the subscription instructions. Membership grants access to ongoing discussions and regular updates on the latest developments in the Lightning Network ecosystem. It is an opportunity to stay informed and actively participate in shaping the future of this rapidly evolving technology.In summary, the Lightning-dev mailing list, hosted by the Linux Foundation, plays a vital role in fostering collaboration and knowledge sharing among developers and enthusiasts interested in the Lightning Network. It serves as a hub for technical discussions, allowing members to exchange ideas, seek guidance, and contribute to the development of this innovative protocol. The mailing list is an invaluable resource for anyone looking to stay connected with the latest developments and engage with a passionate community dedicated to advancing the Lightning Network technology.
